data.chText: 麻布（或厚纸、塑料等）大袋
data.enText: a large bag with no handles, made of strong rough material or strong paper or plastic, used for storing and carrying, for example flour, coal, etc.
a strong paper bag for carrying shopping
the contents of a sack

data.chText: 他们把一麻袋土豆吃完了。
data.enText: They got through a sack of potatoes.
two sacks of groceries
being told by your employer that you can no longer continue working for a company, etc., usually because of sth that you have done wrong
He got the sack for swearing.

data.chText: 她工作干得很差，被炒了鱿鱼。
data.enText: Her work was so poor that she was given the sack .

data.chText: 四百名工人面临解雇的危险。
data.enText: Four hundred workers face the sack.
a bed

data.chText: 他撞见他们俩一起睡在床上。
data.enText: He caught them in the sack together.

data.chText: （在攻陷的城镇中的）抢劫，劫掠
data.enText: the act of stealing or destroying property in a captured town
the sack of Rome
to dismiss sb from a job

data.chText: 她因拒绝在星期天上班被解雇了。
data.enText: She was sacked for refusing to work on Sundays.
(of an army, etc., especially in the past) to destroy things and steal property in a town or building

data.chText: 罗马在410年遭到哥特人的洗劫。
data.enText: Rome was sacked by the Goths in 410.
to knock down the quarterback
sack out
to go to sleep or to bed

means: 麻布(或厚纸、塑料等)大袋

ex.chText: 食品袋/邮包/钱袋/公文袋/旅行袋
ex.enText: a food/mail/money/paper/travelling bag

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用柔软的材料（如布、塑料、皮革等）做成的袋子。

ex.chText: 装烟丝的袋子
ex.enText: a tobacco pouch

ex.chText: 她把她的钱袋递给了我。
ex.enText: She handed her money pouch to me.

synonyms.bx: 指人们用来装小件东西的小包，常放在衣袋内或挂在腰带上。

ex.chText: 她把钱放进了钱包里。
ex.enText: She put the money into her purse.

ex.chText: 她锁上汽车后把钥匙丢进手提包里。
ex.enText: She locked the car and dropped the keys in her purse.

synonyms.bx: 尤指女士放零钱、信用卡等的小钱包，或放化妆品及其他随身小物件的手提包，相当于 handbag。

ex.chText: 一大袋煤/土豆/麦子
ex.enText: a sack of coal/potatoes/wheat

synonyms.bx: 主要用于装面粉、煤、蔬菜等，由结实粗糙的布、纸等材料制成。

ex.chText: 他钱包里有些钱。
ex.enText: There was some money in his wallet.

ex.chText: 她发现地板上有个钱包。
ex.enText: She found a wallet lying on the floor.

synonyms.bx: 指放钞票、信用卡等的钱包，常由皮革制成，男女通用，但在英国英语中仅限于男人所用。

ex.chText: 那名教师被秘密开除了。
ex.enText: That teacher was dismissed/fired/sacked secretly.

ex.chText: 员工上班时间玩电脑游戏会遭到解雇。
ex.enText: Employees can be dismissed/fired/sacked for playing computer games at work.

synonyms.bx: 指正式解除某人的职务，常可与 fire，sack 换用。

ex.chText: 该公司周四宣布计划裁员180人。
ex.enText: The company announced Thursday their plan to axe 180 employees.

ex.chText: 薇拉已被开除出队。
ex.enText: Vera has been axed from the team.

synonyms.bx: 指突然解除某人的职务。

ex.chText: 他刚刚因为迟到被解雇。
ex.enText: He has just been fired/sacked for being late.

ex.chText: 公司把他开除了，他不知该怎么办。
ex.enText: The company fired/sacked him and he didn't know what to do.

synonyms.bx: 指强行解除某人的职务，常可与 sack 换用。

ex.chText: 这家连锁店10月份裁员500人。
ex.enText: The chain store laid off 500 workers in October.

ex.chText: 经济危机期间，数百万工人被解雇。
ex.enText: Millions of workers were laid off during the economic crisis.

synonyms.bx: 指因为没有工作可做而解雇员工。

ex.chText: 委员会罢免了那名腐败的官员。
ex.enText: The committee removed the corrupt official.

ex.chText: 国会有权罢黜总统。
ex.enText: Congress has the right to remove the President from office.

synonyms.bx: 指免除某人的职务，尤指罢免身居要职者。

ex.chText: 他没做错事却被解雇了。
ex.enText: He was sacked from the job, although he did nothing wrong.

ex.chText: 爸爸因为喝醉酒而遭到解雇。
ex.enText: Dad was sacked for being drunk.

data.enText: hit the hay/sack
to go to bed
sack out
to go to sleep or to bed

tr: the termination of someone's employment (leaving them free to depart)
the plundering of a place by an army or mob
a loose-fitting dress hanging straight from the shoulders without a waist
a hanging bed of canvas or rope netting (usually suspended between two trees)
a bag made of paper or plastic for holding customer's purchases
a woman's full loose hiplength jacket
any of various light dry strong white wine from Spain and Canary Islands (including sherry)
the quantity contained in a sack

example: the trapped miners found a pocket of air

tr: discharge from an office or position
example: The boss fired his secretary today
The company terminated 25% of its workers

value.def: A sack is a large bag made of rough woven material. Sacks are used to carry or store things such as vegetables or coal.
value.tran: 麻布袋;粗布袋;厚纸袋;大口袋

value.def: If your employers sack you, they tell you that you can no longer work for them because you have done something that they did not like or because your work was not good enough.

example.ex: Earlier today the Prime Minister sacked 18 government officials for corruption...
example.tran: 今天早些时候，首相解除了 18 名涉嫌贪污腐败的政府官员的职务。

example.ex: Science teacher James Wood was sacked for slapping a schoolboy.
example.tran: 理科教师詹姆斯·伍德因为掌掴一名男生而被开除。

example.ex: People who make mistakes can be given the sack the same day.
example.tran: 一犯错误可能当天就会被开除。

value.def: When an army sacks a town or city, they destroy it, taking away all valuable things.

example.ex: In 1527 Imperial troops sacked the French ambassador's residence in Rome.
example.tran: 1527年，帝国军队洗劫了位于罗马的法国大使官邸。

example.ex: The Odyssey tells what happened to the Greek heroes after the sack of Troy.
example.tran: 《奥德赛》讲述的是在特洛伊被洗劫一空之后发生在希腊英雄们身上的故事。

value.tran: 抢劫，洗劫，破坏(城镇或城市)

value.def: Some people refer to bed as the sack .

trans: 制袋用纸；纸袋纸；袋纸；纸袋
